alert.note: Alert for Brunswick (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 9:14PM EDT until April 29 at 10:38PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... Meherrin River At Lawrenceville affecting Brunswick County. For the Chowan Basin...including Rawlings, Stony Creek, Sebrell, Lawrenceville, Emporia, Franklin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Meherrin River At Lawrenceville. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Friday the stage was 11.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late tonight to 17.0 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon to 6.9 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 08/11/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 915 AM EDT.
